alert.note: Alert for Manatee (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued October 01 at 4:08AM EDT until October 02 at 11:00AM EDT by NWS Tampa Bay
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Florida... Alafia River At Lithia affecting Hillsborough County. Peace River At Zolfo Springs at SR 17 affecting Hardee County. Peace River At Arcadia at SR 70 affecting DeSoto County. Horse Creek Near Arcadia at SR 72 affecting DeSoto County. ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Florida... Manatee River Near Myakka Head at SR 64 affecting Manatee County. .Heavy rainfall associated with Hurricane Ian continues to cause flooding issues along many area rivers. For the Alafia...including Lithia , Riverview near US 301...Moderate flooding is forecast. For the Manatee...including Myakka Head at SR 64, Rye Bridge...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Peace...including Bartow, Zolfo Springs at SR 17, Arcadia at SR 70...Major flooding is forecast. For the Horse Creek...including Arcadia at SR 72...Major flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. This approaches the flood of record. * WHERE...Manatee River Near Myakka Head at SR 64. * WHEN...Until late tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 15.0 feet, Low sections of State Road 64 start to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:15 AM EDT Saturday the stage was 13.9 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 3:15 AM EDT Saturday was 16.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late tonight and continue falling to 6.9 feet early Tuesday morning. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 13.9 feet on 09/19/1994. - https://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (2 am EDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sun Mon Tue Wed Thu Manatee River Myakka Head at SR 11.0 13.9 Sat 3 am 11.3 8.9 6.9 6.1 5.5 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 715 PM EDT.
